page.title: 11BIRDS IN SOUTH LINCOLNSHIRE
page.content: Over one hundred species of birds are to be found in the woodlands. Some examples are woodpeckers, owls, snipe, woodcock and finches which live and breed there. Some birds such as night jars, sedge warblers, wrynecks and yellow wagtails live in the woods in summer but do not breed there. Little grebe, grey heron and meadow pipit inhabit the countryside. Seen only in the winter are the buzzard, golden plover, sparrowhawk, teal, great grey shrike, redwing, hen-harrier, fieldfare and bramling. A kingfisher has been sighted by a stream in the area.
